urls.title: South Withernsea Coastal Defence Scheme - Time-Lapse Footage
urls.description: Construction time-lapse footage of the £7m South Withernsea Coastal Defence Scheme. The scheme was delivered by East Riding of Yorkshire Council and part fun...

text: We've also uploaded new time-lapse footage from our completed £7m South Withernsea Coastal Defence Scheme. The scheme was funded by European Regional Development Fund, FDGiA via @EnvAgencyYNE & a Council contribution. Check it out here: https://t.co/MWMW2oTbfA

urls.title: 88-year-old widow's devastation at being told she can no longer be buried with her husband
urls.description: Active Christian Edith Murden and late husband Reginald paid for a joint plot in a churchyard but, now, she can no longer join him.

text:
4/5 We’ve been speaking regularly but it was good to meet up with @AaronBell4NUL today. 

@EnvAgencyMids primary focus for #WalleysQuarry is @RedIndustries2 reducing odour so I was able to reassure him on behalf of his constituents that’s our priority. https://t.co/1zieoKZPsc

2/5 Our @EnvAgencyMids #enforcement notice requires the #landfill operator to cap parts of #WalleysQuarry by midnight 30/04/21. 

This is an important milestone but there will be more to do limit odour. 

I saw progress today 👇 and discussed next steps with @RedIndustries2 https://t.co/o3V9B20fdG

@LDNWaterkeeper @renton_phil @WandleForum @Feargal_Sharkey @alison_fure @BerrylandsNR @BenGoldsmith @CitizenZoo @LivingWandle @battersea_arts @MjTurner_ @MordenHallPkNT @thameswater @SE_Rivers_Trust @EnvAgency Do the @EnvAgency respond to you?

1/5 Really pleased to be out in #NewcastleunderLyme today with @EnvAgencyMids for a #CovidSafe visit to:
- see @RedIndustries2 progress at #WalleysQuarry
- hear from residents
- see our #airquality monitoring stations
- meet @AaronBell4NUL for an update

urls.title: The Role of Behavioral Ecotoxicology in Environmental Protection
urls.description: For decades, we have known that chemicals affect human and wildlife behavior. Moreover, due to recent technological and computational advances, scientists are now increasingly aware that a wide variety of contaminants and other environmental stressors adversely affect organismal behavior and subsequent ecological outcomes in terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems. There is also a groundswell of concern that regulatory ecotoxicology does not adequately consider behavior, primarily due to a lack of standardized toxicity methods. This has, in turn, led to the exclusion of many behavioral ecotoxicology studies from chemical risk assessments. To improve understanding of the challenges and opportunities for behavioral ecotoxicology within regulatory toxicology/risk assessment, a unique workshop with international representatives from the fields of behavioral ecology, ecotoxicology, regulatory (eco)toxicology, neurotoxicology, test standardization, and risk assessment resulted in the formation of
